content.description: Climb this tricky crack from a crouch start. This is not as easy as it first looks.
content.location: Just left of Zpring Time Arete

content.description: Sit start with right hand on the arete, bump up with difficulty, Zpring for the horisontal break, then finish up with thin crimps on the uppper half.
content.location: The obvious arete on the uphill grouping

content.description:
Every move is classic on this new Dodge testpeice. Super complex sequencing, burly moves, complete with a highball topout. This route may rival Sandstone Violence in both quality and difficulty. 

  Sit down start under a bulge, move up staying on the left side of the arete.
content.protection: Pads, and spotters. Landing is built up with logs, make sure to have good pad coverage over this stuff. Use Extra Caution topping out. It is too tall to clean without a rap line, thus there is still the possibility of loose blocks up there. Knock check holds before pulling hard on them.
content.location: Right arete on tallest grouping of boulders

content.description: Climb the unfun dirty crack to a very difficult move and top out....or dont bother
content.location: Just left of Zummer Time Crack

climbs.name: Low Down with a S.A.D. Frown

content.description: Sit start on the lowest end corner. Traverse up and right into a mantle top out.
content.location: On the seemingly insignificant boulder about 50 yards directly downhill from S.M.A.C.

climbs.name: Little Bit of Lank
climbs.fa: T. Melin, S. Dew, AJ. Christnovich

content.description: Start low on the horizontal break and move  up the face avoiding the crack. The crux is right at the top.
SDS on slopers, up to knob, climb face to mossy slopey topout.
content.location: To the left of Zummertime Crack and to the Right of the clump of trees that is just to the right of Strong Men and Tesselation.

content.description: Start on the prominent knob and work up the crack, using both crack and face holds.
content.location: Obvious crack route on the east end of the uphill grouping of boulders

content.description: Start as for SMAC, but move to the right of the arete and up the face. The first move with be more aesthetic for the funnel chested folks.
content.protection: pad, spotters. Landing is built up with logs, make sure to have good pad coverage over this stuff. Use Extra Caution topping out. It is too tall to clean without a rap line, thus there is still the possibility of loose blocks up there. Knock check holds before pulling hard on them.

content.description: A tight grouping of tall south facing lines, on solid, dry rock. The landings are generally good (but can be built up more). Several of the routes look easy, but are often decievingly difficult.
